oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: T.M. DeMoss & Sons
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Exterior view showing the T.M. DeMoss & Sons Building on Second Avenue. Two cars are parked in front of the entrance. Street signage includes no parking signs and loading zone signs. Part of the Hooper Building is visible to the left, and the American Paper & Twine Company sign is visible on the right. Several storefront windows have air conditioner units. The word “fire” is faintly visible in the middle window on the second-story.

The T.M. DeMoss & Sons building, located at 126 Second Avenue, was a three-story, Italianate style building constructed in 1879. A central parapet on the building is dated 1879. Heavy brackets support the cornice. The center bay of the three bays projects out and with brick corbelling on the second and third story. The arched second-story and third-story windows above the central bay each have a keystone accompanied by natural stones. T.M. DeMoss & Sons moved into the building in 1938.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Boucher, Jack E.; Historic American Buildings Survey
